answers.answer: Hi there!Increased frequency of urination could occur secondary to GU infections/ inflammations, excessive fluid intake, hormonal/ endocrine issues such as diabetes etc. Prostatic enlargement would rather decrease urination. I would suggest considering a detailed evaluation by an internist initially and depending on the cause diagnosed/ suspected, it can be managed accordingly or specialist acre may be sought.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: I recently stopped taking a testosterone suppliment after 5 years as my prostate issues ( i was urinating every 2 hours ) got to be to muchAfter about a week off testosterone , I began to have more frequent urination problems , where I am going every 45 minutes to an hour . I called my eurologist and he put me on Flomax , which I have been taking for two daysI have been on avodart for six monthsI was tested for UTI's and found to be negativeShould I be concerned about the increase in frequent urination ?
title: Frequent Urination
